intro: Dichroa daimingshanensis, commonly known as the Daimingshan dichroa, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Dichroaceae and is characterized by its striking, two-toned flowers that range from white to pink. The plant typically grows in mountainous regions with high humidity and cool temperatures. Its leaves are ovate and glossy, often with a reddish hue on the underside. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
